Photo: James Nielsen, Staff Weights & Measures Where: 2808 Caroline Cost: $$ Opened: January Alison... Image 38 of 38 Your cash is no good at the Runaway Plate 1 / 38 Back to Gallery It is not unusual for some restaurants and food trucks to operate on a cash-only basis.
My beloved oyster dive, Gilhooley’s , banned payment by credit card several years ago and being cash only hasn’t keep taqueria Villa Arcos out of the Alison Cook’s prestigious Top 100.
Now comes a new Spring restaurant that rejects cash. The Runway Plate accepts only credit and debit cards as payment for its wholesome fast food.
This is from its website:
"After conducting a significant amount of research and surveying the community (which resulted in an overwhelming 97% of people willing to pay only by credit/debit card), we have decided to only accept credit/debit cards with no minimum purchase amount; and not to accept cash.
"Our #1 goal (besides serving great food!) is keeping our employees and customers safe. We felt that a restaurant with no cash would minimize the likelihood of crime and theft."
Self identified as an “upscale version of Boston Market,” the Runaway Plate serves from-scratch meals, including gluten-free and vegetarian. For convenience, all plates are in to-go containers. There’s even a drive-through window. If you do eat-in, the restaurant allows BYOB for a $6-$8 corkage fee.
Know any other restaurants that say no to cash? Leave the name in the comments.
The Runaway Plate : 28533 Spring Trails Ridge, Spring
Hours : 3:30-8:30 p.m. daily
Browse the slideshow above to see more restaurants and bars that have opened in 2015.
